Posts.Content: Jul 23, 2015 11:21AM Daisy99 wrote: I'm in the same boat. I'm 33 and terrified.... Try to remember the chances of it being benign are in your favor and keep us posted. Hang in there. Hugs
Posts.Title: Conflicting emotions while waiting for biopsy results Drvsa Moderators

Posts.Content: Jul 24, 2015 02:19PM Daisy99 wrote: update- the mass shrank a centimeter so no biopsy was performed, it has been assumed that is is pregnancy related. I am beyond grateful. Thank you for your support and I am so glad I had this site to help me through this time. You all are very courageous and I wish you all nothing but the best. I will be thinking of you all and praying for you all as well.
Posts.Title: FNA Friday - what to expect? Daisy99 SlowDeepBreaths

Posts.Content: Jul 21, 2015 08:55PM Daisy99 wrote: my little guy is keeping me very busy! I stopped breast feeding at 6 weeks though
Posts.Title: FNA Friday - what to expect? Daisy99 SlowDeepBreaths

Posts.Content: Daisy99 wrote: I posted previously that I'm 6 mo postpartum and found a lump at age 33. Both diagnostic mammo and U.S showed normal breast tissue and a total of 3 radiologists reviewed my films to confirm it was done correctly and it's normal tissue. However, I'm paranoid and sought a surgeon for a second opinion since it feels like a marble by my nipple. She was very blunt in saying of course it could be cancer, it may not be but it could be. Which made me sick to my stomach. She advised a FNA which is what I'm doing Friday, she also is not numbing the area since its close to the surface. I have a bad anxiety disorder and I'm terrified, making myself sick. I'm scared that I can feel this lump and what if it is cancer. But how could it be missed on a digital diagnostic mammo and U.S. With three radiologists confirming its normal breast tissue. How would normal tissue feel like a marble??? Please support... I'm a new mom living far from family and I'm scared sick Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: FNA Friday - what to expect? Daisy99 SlowDeepBreaths

Posts.Content: Jul 21, 2015 08:27PM Daisy99 wrote: thanks so much for your reply. I'm aware age is on my side, but this whole ordeal in itself has changed my view on life in general. I've never had fear like this or felt lumps of any kind anywhere. I wasn't expecting the BS to be so blunt and rough about the chance of it being something to worry about I guess! Especially because of my clear films
